ranked_diseases.explanation: Pontocerebellar hypoplasia type 2 is characterized by progressive microcephaly, global developmental delay, seizures, and hypoplasia of the corpus callosum, which are all present in the patient's phenotypic features.

ranked_diseases.disease_name: Microcephalic Osteodysplastic Primordial Dwarfism Type II
ranked_diseases.explanation: This condition includes progressive microcephaly, global developmental delay, and seizures. Although edema and hypoplasia of the corpus callosum are less commonly reported, the other features align well.
Aicardi syndrome is associated with agenesis or hypoplasia of the corpus callosum, seizures, and developmental delay. Progressive microcephaly and edema are less typical but possible.
This disorder can present with developmental delay, seizures, and hypoplasia of the corpus callosum. Edema and progressive microcephaly are less common but have been reported in some cases.
Zellweger syndrome includes developmental delay, seizures, and hypoplasia of the corpus callosum. Progressive microcephaly and edema can also occur, though they are not the most prominent features.
